experimentation
Class Tracker

java.lang.Object
  experimentation.Tracker

public class Tracker
extends java.lang.Object

This class needs a higher level controller to implement the navigtion logic
Responsibility: keep robot on the line till it senses a marker, then stop
also controls turning to a new line at +- 90 or 180 deg
Hardware: Two light sensors , shielded, 2 LU above floor. Classes used: Pilot, LightSensors
Control Algorithm: proportional control. estimate distance from centerline
Calibrates both sensors to line, background Updated 9/10/2007 NXT hardware

Author:
Roger Glassey

Field Summary
 DifferentialPilot pilot
          controls the motors
 
Constructor Summary
Tracker(DifferentialPilot thePilot, LightSensor leftEye, LightSensor rightEye)
          constructor - specifies which sensor ports are left and right
 
Method Summary
 void calibrate()
          calibrates for line first, then background, then marker with left sensor.
 void stop()
           
 void trackLine()
          follow line till intersection (a black marker) is detected uses proportional control
Error signal is supplied by CLdistance()
uses CLdistance(), pilot.steer() loop execution about 65 times per second in 1 sec.

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

trackLine

public void trackLine()
follow line till intersection (a black marker) is detected uses proportional control
Error signal is supplied by CLdistance()
uses CLdistance(), pilot.steer() loop execution about 65 times per second in 1 sec.

stop

public void stop()

calibrate

public void calibrate()
calibrates for line first, then background, then marker with left sensor. displays light sensor readings on LCD (percent)
Then displays left sensor (scaled value). Move left sensor over marker, press Enter to set marker value to sensorRead()/2
